result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul F. Cleereman Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Paul F. Cleereman Jr.
parties.address: 5376 Linden St. P.O. Box 392, Laona, WI 54541

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Jail sentence in Forest county case 15CF112.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.

Defendant must seek anger management or similar treatment and follow thru with all recommendations. 

Any other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week and provide proof to P&P.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:15 PM. Joy has received the revocation summary and does not note any inaccuracies or mistakes in it. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends on counts #2 and #3 - 6 months in county jail on each count, concurrent to each other but consecutive to the time he is serving on 15CF153. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 60-150 days in county jail, concurrent to any jail time. Cleereman makes statement - asks the Court to run the time concurrent. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - 6 months on each count, concurrent to each other but each count is consecutive to the time he is currently serving on 15CF153 - no credit for this case, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgments, submit DNA sample with expungment rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
letter from DOC asking for clarification on JOC - clerk amended JOC

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:05 AM. On 15CF153 - waives reading of complaint, requests PH and will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, set for PH. State - bond - $2000.00 signature bond. Burns - no objections. Court - $2000.00 signature bond. State - on 15CF112 - amend #2 to county ordinance of DC and plead to amended count #2 with fine of $300 plus costs, plead G/NC to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, court costs on each count, #1 - 30 days in FC jail, #3 - 90 days in FC jail - consecutive to count #1, #4 - DRI; 15CF125 - amend count #2 and #3 to misd bail jumpings each - plead to amended counts #2 and #3, #1 - DRI, probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on 15CF112, conditions of court costs, AODA and follow thru, 200 hours of community service, any other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P. State mentions to Court and Burns that the defendant's mother has asked that a condition be added of no entry into the bar of his mother or the premises. Burns and Cleereman agree. Court - 15CF112 - amends count #2 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - due at rate of $50.00/month commencing on the first day of the month following release from incarceration. Cleerman pleads NC to counts #1 and #3, court dismisses and reads in count #4. Court - on 15CF125 - court amends counts #2 and #3 to misd bail jumping - reads new charge and penalty. Cleereman pleads NC to counts #2 and #3 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations - credit for 42 days. Cleereman withholds comment. Court sentences the defendnat to the following: 15CF112 - count #1 - costs - add to payment plan, 30 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 22 days; count #3 - 90 days in FC jail - consecutive to count #1 - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), costs - add to payment plan; 15CF125 - counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on 15CF112 - with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, costs on each count - paid thru probation, 200 hours of community service (total), seek anger management or similar treatment and follow thru, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, attend at least on AA meeting each week and provide proof of attendance to P&P, any other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P, gives ramifications of not complying and/or successfully completing probation and may impose jail time, submit DNA sample and gave expungement collaquey, right to appeal, adjourned.
Prelim Waiver and Bond Hearing - August 27, 2015
No consumption of alcohol, no entry into any taverns/bars, must immediately be admitted to Koinonia (participate and successfully complete the program.)

Defendant Paul F. Cleereman in court, in custody, with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 8:51 AM. State - in anticipation of filing of waiver of PH, has filed INFO which mirrors, amended complaint just adds to the probable cause as to where the bail jumping stems from. Burns - defendant understands. Court goes over waiver form and finds defenant has freely and voluntarily waived his right to a PH. Finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Burns waives further reading of INFO and enters NG pleas on all counts. Burns asks for bond to be reduced to signature bond to be release to jail to go directly to Koninia and asks for FPT to be set out 30 days. State - if signature bond is granted asking that he be returned to FOSO after completion of program. Court - reduces to $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any taverns/bars, must immediately be admitted to Koinonia (participate and successfully complete the program.)  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, court may reduce to signature bond if treatment is arranged.

Defendant Paul F. Cleereman appears via video from FOSO with attorney Mary L.R. Burns appearing personally.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:12 AM. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns and Cleereman understand charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH. Cleereman asks for signature bond, wants to go to treatment. State - bond - reduce to $500.00 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars. Burns - bond - requests signature bond to allow the defendant the opportunity to go into treatment. Court - bond - $500.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, court may reduce to signature bond if treatment is arranged.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:45 am.
